image.altText: Three crashed vehicles with police at scene.

items.synopsis: Three people were killed in the crash after an Isuzu, which police allege was stolen at knifepoint, was seen chasing and ramming another vehicle onto the wrong side of the highway.

title.children: Triple highway fatality now being treated as a domestic violence homicide investigation

image.altText: Spanish players cheer and hug each other on the pitch.

items.synopsis: Spain quickly take the lead in their World Cup opener against Costa Rica, who deliver the first own goal of the tournament. Follow the excitement on and off the pitch with the ABC live blog.

title.children: Spain lead Costa Rica 3-0 following own goal in World Cup opener

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Spain were playing in the box. Fabiola Villalobos was penalised for bringing down Spain's Olga Carmona in the penalty area. Truth be told, they didn't touch each other. Carmona could be up for a Logie with that performance. But Costa Rica's goalkeeper was was to the task, parrying away Jenni Hermoso attempt.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 33': Penalty to Spain and they miss

children.content: Spain were playing in the box.
Fabiola Villalobos was penalised for bringing down Spain's
Olga Carmona in the penalty area.
Truth be told, they didn't touch each other. Carmona could be up for a Logie with that performance.
But Costa Rica's goalkeeper was was to the task, parrying away

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Spain are on fire. They peppered the penalty box. Corners and saves. Then finally the third goal comes. The cross was fired in from the left. Number 10 Jenni Hermoso headers it into the crossbar. It bounces back and Esther González finishes it off.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 27': SPAIN HAVE THREE

children.content: Then finally the third goal comes.
The cross was fired in from the left.
Jenni Hermoso headers it into the crossbar.

props.alt: Spanish players hug each other on the field.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Costa Rica are in trouble. Spain continue their dominace, There were neat touches in the build-up. Ona Batlle has the ball in the box, near the by-line. She cuts it back into the middle of the box for Aitana Bonmatí. BANG. Great curling shot into the left of the goal.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 23': GOAL SPAIN

children.content: Ona Batlle has the ball in the box, near the by-line. She cuts it back into the middle of the box for
Great curling shot into the left of the goal.

image.altText: A smartphone with Facebook's logo is seen in front of displayed Facebook's new rebrand logo Meta in this illustration

items.synopsis: Inspired by Australian laws to make social media giants pay for access to news content, Canada says it is enduring "bullying" tactics from tech companies who oppose the legislation.

title.children: Canada faces down 'bullying' from Facebook owner Meta, as it pursues Australian-style laws

image.altText: Man with glasses and blazer in front of art

items.synopsis: A man found dead off rocks in Sydney's eastern suburbs after a boat crash on Thursday is identified as renowned art dealer Tim Klingender.

title.children: Prominent art dealer identified as boating crash victim in Sydney's east as rescue crews search for second man

image.altText: A sunburnt, man with grey beard stands shirtless on a boat with the Australian flag.

items.synopsis: After 86 days at sea, Rob Barton is believed to be the first person to row non-stop solo and unassisted across the Indian Ocean from Australia to Africa.

title.children: Man rows from Australia to Africa to raise funds for youth mental health

image.altText: A pile of australian coins on a yellow backdrop.

items.synopsis: Inflation might be softening in some places around the world, but the price of things like groceries remains high.

title.children: Inflation is falling in Australia and New Zealand. Here's how we stack up with the rest of the world

image.altText: A white man with light brown hair and wearing a grey 40s suit, stands in a windswept and gloomy desert landscape.

items.synopsis: Christopher Nolan’s masterful movie fuses spectacle and melancholy to tell the true story of J Robert Oppenheimer, who oversaw the creation of the atomic bomb and changed the course of history.

title.children: Why Oppenheimer is the film you should go and see this week

image.altText: Photo of a power plant, with concrete cylinders and smoke against a grey sky

items.synopsis: After benchmark power prices jumped hundreds of dollars a year, a senior energy researcher questions whether households will end up paying too much.

title.children: Claims consumers may be paying 'too much' for power after big falls in wholesale prices

image.altText: Happiness

items.synopsis: Treasurer Jim Chalmers releases a long-awaited wellbeing report but admits there are "gaps" in the data and says he is "open to feedback".

title.children: First 'wellbeing budget' finds Australians are living longer but they are less satisfied

image.altText: A screenshot of an Adelaide Review article in Spanish.

items.synopsis: Spanish opinion polling and data analysis has been posted to the defunct cultural magazine The Adelaide Review, in apparent attempt to circumvent Spanish electoral laws ahead of the country's upcoming general election.

title.children: Defunct Adelaide publication posts Spanish election poll results ahead of vote

image.altText: An underwater photo of a whale tangled in pearling lines

items.synopsis: Rescuers have told of their joy at freeing an 11-metre humpback whale stuck in pearling lines for three days off the WA coast, the second to become entangled near Broome since the weekend.

title.children: Humpback whale freed from pearling lines off Kimberley coast

image.altText: Three Nigeria teammates celebrate with Chiamaka Nnadozie after the Women's World Cup match against Canada.

items.synopsis: Spurred on by vibrant support from its fans, Nigeria frustrates Canada in a 0-0 draw at the World Cup, proving the Super Falcons will be a dangerous opponent when they face the Matildas next week.

title.children: Nigeria shows why Matildas need to be on guard at the World Cup

image.altText: Canberra Raiders player Jamal Fogarty runs past two Warriors defenders with the ball in hand.

items.synopsis: Canberra and New Zealand will meet in Auckland, with honour and a top-four berth up for grabs. Follow our ScoreCentre for all the live scores and stats.

title.children: NRL live: Raiders out for revenge against Warriors, with top-four honours on the line

image.altText: Generic prison image.  File photo from November, 2011.

items.synopsis: Prisoners at a privately run jail — one of the largest in NSW— should not receive "sub-optimal" medical care, according to a state Coroner.

title.children: Inmate received 'second-rate medical care' before his death, inquest finds

image.altText: A WA Police badge on an officer's shirt shoulder.

items.synopsis: Police say a man is assisting them with enquiries, after the child was picked up in an unknown vehicle while walking to school.

title.children: Man in police custody after 9yo girl allegedly abducted walking to school

image.altText: Coles milk prices up to $1.10 a litre

items.synopsis: Farmers and the nation's competition watchdog are worried about a deal that could see Coles control a large part of the milk supply chain.

title.children: 'Extremely scary': Dairy farmers, ACCC concerned about Coles' bid to buy milk processing plants

image.altText: Man stand in front of trees in the background with a black hat and jumper on

items.synopsis: Alice Springs Mayor Matt Paterson says the announcement that alcohol restrictions the town would continue for at least a further 12 months came as a "shock".

title.children: 'Kicking the can down the road': Alice Springs advocates call for support beyond alcohol restrictions

image.altText: Bare branches covering a large beige building in the background

items.synopsis: The Adelaide District Court heard the 36-year-old created an Instagram account pretending to be a 16-year-old boy and exchanged more than 215,000 messages with children, but never met his victims.

title.children: Former RAAF intelligence officer sentenced over child exploitation material

image.altText: A soldier stands in the foreground with a missile launcher parked atop a hill, ready to fire.

items.synopsis: Japan's top military officer General Yoshihide Yoshida is in Australia inspecting his country's most advanced anti-ship weapon as part of his country's largest ever participation in Exercise Talisman Sabre.

title.children: Japan's top general inspects anti-ship missile ahead of historic Australian launch

image.altText: A woman with dark features smiles looking away from the camera

items.synopsis: Tina Quinn, 34, remains missing after last being seen at her Yass acreage on July 16. Authorities are expanding their search for the woman.

title.children: Tina has been missing for five days. Her husband is publicly pleading for answers about his 'really gentle' wife

image.altText: Victorian police car with lights on

items.synopsis: Victoria Police's Homicide Squad and Professional Standards Command are investigating after a man was critically injured during an arrest in Melbourne's south.

title.children: Man critical after being tasered and shot with bean bag rounds after Melbourne siege

image.altText: Two people look.

items.synopsis: When a massive power surge damaged their home's roller door, coffee machine and two air conditioning units, Gunta and Phillip Groves were left with an estimated damage bill of tens of thousands of dollars, without the support of insurance or compensation.

title.children: Couple left tens of thousands of dollars out of pocket after major power surge

image.altText: A woman looks sad while sitting on an esky on the sidelines.

items.synopsis: Tony Gustavsson says the secrecy surrounding Sam Kerr's injury was partly about tactics, as questions are raised about how long the Matildas star will be out.

title.children: Matildas coach explains secrecy around Kerr injury in 'tough 24 hours' before World Cup opener

image.altText: Newcastle Knights NRLW players celebrate with the premiership trophy.

items.synopsis: With the expanded NRLW competition kicking off this weekend, the addition of four extra teams marks a new dawn for the women's game.

title.children: Five quick hits — everything you need to know about the 2023 NRLW season

image.altText: A white woman wearing a green blouse, with shoulder-length blonde hair, looks steadily at the camera.

items.synopsis: Japan's sole custody laws have long been criticised for incentivising child abduction, but the system may be about to change, with Australia playing a key role behind the scenes.

title.children: For four years, Catherine has fought Japan's highest court to be reunited with her children

image.altText: Three views of the birthday cake clock, with the uncleaned original centre.

items.synopsis: A Queensland couple's garden shed clean-out turns up a valuable piece of Victorian history in the form of a birthday cake clock.

title.children: A milk crate of junk almost went to the dump. In it was a historic artefact worth $48k

image.altText: A security surveillance camera is seen near the Microsoft office building in Beijing.

items.synopsis: Beijing-linked hackers access US Ambassador to China Nicholas Burns's email account in an espionage operation thought to have compromised at least hundreds of thousands of individual US government emails, the Wall Street Journal and CNN report.

title.children: Chinese hackers breach US ambassador's emails in Microsoft hack, reports say

image.altText: Raghe Mohammed Abdi smiles a the camera. He wears a school uniform consisting of a maroon jacket and tie, and a blue shirt.

items.synopsis: Police said, when they offered to help Mr Abdi — who was walking alongside a busy motorway — he yelled and ran at them with a knife.

title.children: Police opened fire fearing their lives were in danger when man ran at them with a knife, inquest told

image.altText: A close-up of an ant grooming itself

items.synopsis: The discovery of red fire ants in the Tallebudgera Valley has reignited calls for urgent action to be taken to prevent the pest's spread into New South Wales.

title.children: Discovery of red fire ants 5km from NSW border sparks fresh calls for boost to state and federal eradication funding

image.altText: A young Asian woman with long dark hair poses for a selfie.

items.synopsis: The court heard Joon Seong Tan murdered Melbourne woman Ju 'Kelly' Zhang in a jealous rage, then let her eight-year-old son believe she had left him.

title.children: 'Simply cruel': Judge sentences man who murdered his girlfriend and dumped her body in a wheelie bin

items.synopsis: Here's a quick wrap of the COVID-19 news and case numbers from each Australian jurisdiction from the past week.

image.altText: Black and white photo from 1902, showing side profile of young woman in her 20s, Victorian era hair and blouse.

items.synopsis: A rare personal copy of Woolf’s first novel with the author's handwritten revisions offers tantalising glimpses into the mind and process of one of the 20th century’s most significant writers. Now the public can access it online.

title.children: Sydney discovery of Virginia Woolf novel with handwritten notes offers glimpse into brilliant mind

image.altText: A bald man wearing a bright orange vests laughs with another man wearing a back jumper, they're in a warehouse.

items.synopsis: Australia's buoyant jobs market is so far easily absorbing a record migrant intake, with many employers turning to retirees to fill vacant positions.

title.children: When Diogo was looking for experience, hiring Andrew out of retirement was a 'no brainer'

image.altText: The Australian passport in front of a night-mode world map

items.synopsis: Australia's passport just became more powerful. Here's where it, and other countries, rank according to The Henley Passport Index.

title.children: Singapore has overtaken Japan as the world's most powerful passport. Where does Australia sit?

image.altText: tillies jump

items.synopsis: The Matildas ground out a 1-0 win over Ireland to start their home Women's World Cup campaign, and the internet was in agony.

title.children: 'This team will be the end of me': How the internet reacted to the Matildas' 1-0 win over Ireland
